results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work with the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land.

results.title: Kakadu: land of the crocodile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a crocodile attack. Against the backdrop of the steamy, intensely beautiful Kakadu National Park, viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife.

results.title: South West Tasmania: The Gliders (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Millar, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
The sheer challenge of remote wilderness is shown in this spectacular program of a group’s arduous trek up Federation Peak with the aim of hang gliding from the top. Young and old take part in the trek and viewers share in the thoughts, inspiration and differing goals of the group.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
The sheer challenge of remote wilderness is shown in this spectacular program which is Part 4 in a series of 6 documentaries, of a group’s arduous trek to Federation Peak with the aim of hang gliding from the summit. Young and old participate in the trek and viewers share the thoughts, inspiration and differing goals of the group.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Cartoonist Michael Leunig records his impressions of Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and the vast emptiness of the Simpson Desert. Viewers are privy to a special meeting of minds and cultures when he shares a canvas on the sand with Aboriginal artist, Michael Nelson.

results.title: The Australian Alps: Mirka's Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
This program is the last in a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Mirka Mora is an eccentric artist, French by birth, who had never before ventured into the wilderness nor slept in a tent. Along with Tim McCartney Snape, the first Australian ever to reach the summit of Mt. Everest, and a Nepalese Sherpa, she travels into the Kosciusko wilderness. Mirka’s unique and expressive personality helps viewers see and experience this wilderness from an artist’s perspective.
results.title_for_label: The Australian Alps: Mirka’s Palace of Dreams (Captioned)
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, David Morgan and Kestrel Film Productions

group_works.creator_credit: Vanessa Gorman and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

group_works.title: Wives' tales
group_works.creator_credit: Claire Forster and Australian Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Wives' tales
results.creator_credit: Claire Forster and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
280 families were affected by the deployment of the 7th and 8th battalion with INTERFET (UN Sanctioned International Force in East Timor). For the women and families left behind, there was a pressing need for group support. Shying away from a tag such as “the army wives club,” Patti-Jane Gould established the P.I.T. crew - Partners In Timor. The women of this support network speak candidly of the impact their partners departure has had on them and their children, how it feels to say goodbye, their fears, and how they adjust when life returns to “normal.” Army personnel share their fears and thoughts too and how their lives have changed since Timor. Finally, we share an emotional reunion on the docks. Introduced by Lieutenant General Peter Cosgrove.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
280 families were affected by the deployment of the 7th and 8th battalion with INTERFET (UN Sanctioned International Force in East Timor). For the women and families left behind, there was a pressing need for group support. Shying away from a tag such as “the army wives club,” Patti-Jane Gould established the P.I.T. crew - Partners In Timor. The women of this support network speak candidly of the impact their partners departure has had on them and their children, how it feels to say goodbye, their fears, and how they adjust when life returns to “normal.” Army personnel share their fears and thoughts too and how their lives have changed since Timor. Finally, we share an emotional reunion on the docks. Introduced by Lieutenant General Peter Cosgrove.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Australian story (Television program)”.
280 families were affected by the deployment of the 7th and 8th battalion with INTERFET (UN Sanctioned International Force in East Timor). For the women and families left behind, there was a pressing need for group support. Shying away from a tag such as “the army wives club,” Patti-Jane Gould established the P.I.T. crew - Partners In Timor. The women of this support network speak candidly of the impact their partners departure has had on them and their children, how it feels to say goodbye, their fears, and how they adjust when life returns to “normal.” Army personnel share their fears and thoughts too and how their lives have changed since Timor. Finally, we share an emotional reunion on the docks. Introduced by Lieutenant General Peter Cosgrove.
